lines.text: Each with one property held constant

secText:
Essential Question:
How can we describe the engine cycle using work, heat, pressure, volume, and temperature?

Enduring Understandings:
1. In the first step of an engine cycle, heat flows into the system, causing the temperature and pressure of the system to increase, while the volume is constant. In the second step of an engine cycle, work is done by the system, causing the pressure and temperature of the system to decrease. Heat flows out of the system. In the third step of an engine cycle, work is done on the system, and the engine returns to its initial state.
2. In an adiabatic process, there is no heat transfer into or out of the system. In an isobaric process, pressure remains constant. In a constant volume process, there is no work done by the system.
Vocabulary: adiabatic, isobaric

STEM Skills:
1. Review heat engines.
